info.name: Clark's nucleus
info.description: Clark's nucleus is AKA the nucleus dorsalis. It is a columnar group of large neurons located in the medial aspect of the intermediate gray matter of spinal cord segments T1 through L2 or L3. It receives proprioceptive input from large diameter primary afferents that serve the ipsilateral lower extremity. It projects to the ipsilateral cerebellum via the ipsilateral lateral funiculus as the dorsal spinocerebellar tract.
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/2 Lumbar cord, middle
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/3 Lumbar cord, upper
/Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/4 Thoracic cord
